New Records: Mitchell Marsh was announced as the 'Player of the Match' for his 72 unbeaten runs and one wicket taken in the first innings.
Key Match Events: Travis Head (24) and David Warner (32) gave a good start before being dismissed by Adam Milne and Mitchell Santner.
Tim David (31*) stood till the last with Mitchell Marsh and led the Australian team to defeat New Zealand by 6 wickets.
Mitchell Marsh (72*) remained on the crease and built small partnership with Glenn Maxwell (25) and Josh Inglis (20).
Pre-Game Insights: The Aussies are also in have been in red-hot form after defeating the West Indies 2-1 for the recently concluded T20 series and will be aiming to replicate this form against their neighbours.
Moreover, this young Aussie side would be aiming to give David Warner a warm farewell on his last bilateral T20 series.
New Zealand, on the other hand, won their last T20I series against Pakistan with a 4-1 margin and will be aiming to dominate their opponents in last T20 matches before the World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Australian skipper Mitchell Marsh was announced as the 'Player of the Match' for his 72 unbeaten runs and one wicket taken in the first innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sky Stadium pitch, while offering something for the bowlers, is likely to be more in favour of the batsmen, meaning a big score would be the likely outcome.
Others: For the Kiwis, Mitchell Santner picked two wickets, while Lockie Ferguson and Adam Milne took one each.
Batting first, Kiwis ended the first innings at Wellington on a total of 215/3, their second highest score at this venue.
